page.title: 05Farming in Peter Tavy Area
page.content: The average farm in this area consists of 164 acres.Most of the farmers own their land and farming has been their only occupation.Most of these farmers have one employee.The average working day is eleven hours, but most farmers manage to have a holiday.The main kind of farming is dairy farming.The breeds used are Friesian and South Devon.There is also some beef cattle;Herefords and Scotch cattle.Farmers also use Limousin for either dairy or beef farming.Sheep farmers use white-faced Dartmoor, Cheviot,Jacob and Suffolk breeds.Some farmers grow barley or kale to feed their cattle in winter. Many farmers own woodland which gives shelter for young stock. Most of the farmers have a stream,river, or spring on their land which is a great asset.All the farmers have plenty of machines.
